content.description: Researchers were studying the effects of microbes on the growth of the yellow bedstraw plant, Galium verum. They grew yellow bedstraw plants under four treatments: in the presence of soil bacteria only, arbuscular mycorrhizal (<math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) fungi only, both bacteria and <math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fungi, or neither. After 6 months, they measured the biomass of the plants (Figure 1).
content.question: Figure 1. The Effect of Soil Microbes on the Biomass of Galium verum <math alttext="Mean, plus or minus, 2 S E sub x bar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Mean</mtext><mo>±</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> Which of the following best describes a statistical relationship indicated in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: Yellow bedstraw plants grow significantly more in the presence of both soil bacteria and <math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fungi (treatment 4) than in the presence of soil bacteria alone (treatment 2).

Yellow bedstraw plants, in the presence of <math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fungi (treatment 3), grow significantly more if soil bacteria (treatment 4) are also present.
Yellow bedstraw plants grow significantly more when soil bacteria (treatment 2) are present compared to when there are no soil bacteria (treatment 1).

Yellow bedstraw plants grown in soil without bacteria and <math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fungi (treatment 1) grow significantly more than when only <math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fungi is present in the soil (treatment 3).

content.answer: Yellow bedstraw plants grow significantly more in the presence of both soil bacteria and <math alttext="A M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> fungi (treatment 4) than in the presence of soil bacteria alone (treatment 2).

skill.text: 5.B: Use confidence intervals and error bars to estimate whether sample means are statistically different.
